poem:
In Tender Irony of Life's Caprice

Oh jesters of the day, crafting melancholy,
Training youth in disharmonious hymns -
Veil of Dismaland, an exercise in folly,
Through foggy irony, the dawn still brims.

Tony Allen, in silence profound,
Chivalry replaced by comedic sound.
A graffiti artist whispers from the mist,
Ringing out laughs that forever persist.

As Heaven's vaudeville receives a new soul,
Banksy's tribute echoes, making us whole.
